form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: U.S. DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE BUREAU OF THE CENSUS, FL10-606

full_text: FL10-606 U. S. DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE Formerly ADS-382-B (8-9-55) BUREAU OF THE CENSUS WASHINGTON 25, D. C. IN REPLY REFER TO: 539-915 June 15, 1956 Mrs. Anne Friedlander Re: Anne Friedlander 35 Eckert Avenue Louis Fiener Newark 12, New Jersey Rose Fiener Dear Mrs. Friedlander: This is in reply to your request for information from the Census records. A. Personal information recorded during the Census of 1900 and later Censuses is confidential and may be furnished only if desired for a proper purpose upon the written request of the person to whom the information re- lates or his legal representative (such as guardian, upon presentation of a certified copy of the court order appointing the legal representative; or parent of a child now under 16 years of age). B. In case of death the information may be furnished (1) the parent, child, husband, wife, brother, or sister of the deceased, upon presenta- tion of a certified copy of the death certificate; (2) the beneficiary of the deceased, upon presentation of proof of identity of beneficiary; or (3) the administrator or executor of the estate, upon presentation of a certified copy of the court order appointing the administrator or executor. Additional information: Before a search of the census records for information concerning you and your parents can be made, it will be necessary for each of you to complete and sign an application in accordance with the instructions on the reverse side, giving your exact places of residence on the dates of the Federal censuses. If deceased, we must be supplied with an authorization in accordance with paragraph B. Application forms are enclosed. The applications for your parents must be accompanied with the required fee. The remittance of $4.00 is acknow- ledged. Sincerely yours, Everett H. Burke Chief, Administrative Service Division Bureau of the Census Comm-DC 15832
